did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Cornell University Track and Field collection, ca. 1886-2000
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Materials documenting the history of the track teams at Cornell.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Materials documenting the history of the track teams at Cornell. Collection contains a collection of training logs and results books as well as various programs and ephemera relating to events and operations of the track team. Many photos and slides of individual team members and events, some photos include trips to England. A collection of medals won by Walker Smith is included as well as another set won by Daniel B. Strickler. Material from Los Angeles, Antwerp, Berlin and Oslo Summer Olympic Games material from Cornell Olympians including film footage and photos. Winning jersey bib number plates worn by winners in track and field at the 1920 Antwerp Belgium Olympics, this includes non-U.S. and non-Cornell winners as well, some are signed. Many films of various track events and training sessions. Films include, but are not limited to: IC4A and Heptagonal track and field events, 1932; Penn Relays, 1955; 1952 Olympics. Also a film primarily concerning Cornell athletics, including track and field and baseball that includes Spring Day games, a parade, male students clowning, and the Green Dragon. Also pictorial log of the trip to England of the track teams of Cornell University and Princeton University. The album has photographs, clippings, and memorabilia documenting the Anglo-American Athletic Match track and field events held in England between Cornell and Princeton and Oxford and Cambridge in July 1930. Also programs from the Niagara Track & Field Hall of Fame, featuring Cornellians.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell University Track and Field collection, #40-9-1820. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Walter Ashbaugh '51, Meredith Gourdine '52 and Charles H. Moore '51 competed at the 52 Olympics and may be featured on the film.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Hunt Bradley papers, #41-2-1550, http://resolver.library.cornell.edu/cgi-bin/EADresolver?id=RMA01550

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. General papers, photographs and ephemera
Box 1, 7, 9, 10, Mapcase

Series II. Training and Results Books
Box 2-3

Series III. Oversize Photographs
Box 4-6, Mapcase

Series IV. Videos and Film
Box 7-8

did.unittitle: Series I. General papers, photographs, and ephemera
NY state intercollegiate Track and Field meet. Rome, NY

scopecontent.p: One photo features many of the track coach contemporaries of Jack Moakley at an event. Also includes program from the March 24, 1923 Michigan Dual Meet.

did.unittitle: Disassembled collage featuring the number plates worn by track and field athletes on their jerseys at the 1920 Olympics in Antwerp Belgium who won gold medals.

scopecontent.p:
Several of the number plates are autographed by the athletes. The plates include Frank Foss, (Cornell '17) signed, Joseph Guillemot, Albert Hill signed (also appears signed by Horace Hallock Brown, Hannes Kolehmainen, Richmond Landon signed, Frank Loomis signed (also signed by Frank Sheehan Cornell trainer, Pat McDonald signed, Charley Paddock, Bevil Rudd, Patrick Ryan signed, and Earl Thomson. The one for Allen Woodring is missing. There are also two that have name labels that do not correspond with who won gold. They are shot put labeled "Finnthuma" actually won by Ville Pörhölä and broad jump labeled "Finna" actually won by William Petersson.
Also includes a picture of Jack Moakley and Frank Sheehan and a U.S. Olympic track team patch. See photo on CD-1941 (located in Box 1, as well) for picture before it was disassembled.

did.unittitle: Pieces of the 1920 Olympic collage from folder 8.

scopecontent.p: Includes negatives of what appear to be the IC4A and English meets of 1949. Also slides of the 1949 English meet and training slides of shot put showing technique at all stages of the throw and other 1949 slides.
Some of the prints come from a film can of negatives in folder 1-44. They include photos of Meredith Gourdine.
Film cannister of negatives. Some of the prints from this can are in an envelope in folder 1-16. They include photos of Meredith Gourdine.

did.unittitle: Projector photograph slides of the 1950 England trip

scopecontent.p: With Cornell and Princeton track teams for matches against Cambridge and Oxford. Includes photos of the matches, but also photos of the ships they traveled on, various landmarks, stops in Paris, climbing the Eiffel Tower, Luxembourg Gardens, Statue of Liberty. Roger Bannister would compete at one of the events.

did.unittitle: Charles Moore Jr., winner of a gold and silver medal

scopecontent.p: Includes some slides.

scopecontent.p: "A pictorial log of the trip to England of the track teams of Cornell University and Princeton University." The album has photographs, clippings, and memorabilia documenting the Anglo-American Athletic Match track and field events held in England between Cornell and Princeton and Oxford and Cambridge in July 1930.

did.unittitle: Glass plate negative of 2 Cornell runners - Henry Norton Stone and Frederic Kimball Lovejoy
Photos from the 1934 and 1938 England trip
Varsity track wearer of the C certificate of Clarence Francis Spindler
Photos and ephemera from the 1930 England trip

scopecontent.p: Includes letter from Princeton's Alfred Mills to Cornell's Carl Henry Meinig mentioning the trip and a newsclipping from The Illustrated and Sporting Dramatic News, July 19, 1930.

did.unittitle: Track medals won by Walker Smith '20

scopecontent.p: 32 medals removed from mounting on a board. The medals are from a number of different competitions including, the Amateur Athletic Union of the United States, Svensk Amerikanska, IC4A, Meadowbrook Club of Philadelphia, Achilles Club of Britain, Queens Club of London, Boston Athletic Association, New York Athletic Club, Harvard, Yale, 1920 Olympics in Antwerp Belgium medal presented by John Hylan, mayor of New York and others.

did.unittitle: Track medals won by Daniel Strickler '22

scopecontent.p: 3 medals, one for the 1 mile run at the Indoor Triangular Meet 1922 with Cornell, Dartmouth, Harvard meet, one from the International Track & Field Meet on Travers Island with Oxford, Cambridge, Princeton, Cornell meet and one a medallion with an image of runners on it..

did.unittitle: Wood frame engraved with former runners initials.

scopecontent.p: A photo of Jack Moakley in front of a very similar, but different wood frame can be seen in Box 1 folder 41.
